result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre C Dallas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary (Home Invasion) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Burglary (Home Invasion) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Burglary (Home Invasion) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's pro se request for a pass to attent his sister's graduation on June 13.
DENYING REQUEST FOR GOOD TIME signed and filed
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for good time.

The defendant's motion or request for additional release privileges is DENIED.  Additional release privileges would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless, and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent - signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for elder care.

Defendant Andre C Dallas in court with attorney Glenn O. Givens.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:  Sentencing proceeds. No corrections made to PSI report. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's father, Charles D., defendant's mother, Brenda D., and defendant's sister, Brandy V.

Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS, concurrent to each other.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS. 
Credit given for 5 days time served if revoked.

Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin of Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 10 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Corrections with release privileges for employment, school, and AODA treatment purposes only.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with UW- Milwaukee.
* No contact with the co-actors, Rendell Giles and Michael Scott, Jr.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless already done) and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $20.00 to the victim, Brittney H., joint and several, with co-actors Rendell Giles (14CF769) AND Michael Scott, Jr. (14CF770) To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $40.00 to the victim, Victor B., joint and several, with co-actors Rendell Giles (14CF769) AND Michael Scott, Jr. (14CF770). To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $50.00 to the victim, Gavin L., joint and several, with co-actors Rendell Giles (14CF769) AND Michael Scott, Jr. (14CF770). To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $100.00 to the victim, Colin L., joint and several, with co-actors Rendell Giles (14CF769) AND Michael Scott, Jr. (14CF770). To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

FILED, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Andre C Dallas in court with attorney Glenn O. Givens.  Sarah McNutt for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with sentencing today.
Parties wish to adjourn this matter along with co-defendant, Michael Scott's, case.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 09-26-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.
for Presentence Investigation Report; signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for processing.
with attached Restitution Worksheet as to victim, Brittney H., filed by ADA Catelin Ringersma on behalf of the State.
(3) RESTITUTION WORKSHEETS filed by ADA Catelin Ringersma on behalf of the State.

Defendant Andre C Dallas in court with attorney Glenn O Givens.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #4 and Count #5 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

**Court ordered a Presentence Investigation Report with a sentencing recommendation.
Note:  PSI writer is to contact Atty. Givens prior to interviewing the defendant.

Case adjourned to 08-07-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received, signed, and filed with court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
